text: No need to experiment. It’s pretty fantastic.
I’ve got a few regrowths. I remember thinking seasons past was too close to praetors counsel in cost but it’s always been crushing when I’ve seen it cast
Having it put itself back on the bottom vs exile is very relevant too. Often I don’t need or want everything back in my hand.
Given there’s only Seasons Past and Ever After, do we count that as a cycle?
It's a pseudo-cycle
Or an incomplete cycle
We should complete it!
How often do a WotC create parts of a cycle at different rarities?
A vertical cycle? That's a little unusual
Not as common as horizontal cycles at least
SP is at mythic whole EV is simply at rare. More fuel to the pseudo cycle.
Oh, I see. I had never noticed that. That's interesting

I wonder if they’d originally intended to create a cycle but then abandoned it and simply created cards with some shared characteristics. They could have made SP get two cards to match but they wanted something more mythic in power.
And by that I mean to fill a mythic slot in the file.
What would the common and uncommon in the cycle do? It's clear that it would cost 4MM
I don’t think we could go that route since it would seriously shaft one of the colors in the cycle.
And leave another color out altogether

How about this for a red Mythic version: 

Burning Memories

4RR

Discard your hand and exile that many cards from the top of your library. Until end of turn you may sacrifice a land to play a card exiled this way instead of paying its mana cost. 

Put Burning Memories on the bottom of its owner’s library.
That's really strong
I thought about exiling them face down, sac a land to play one at random.
Also gets around colors. You could play this in a mono red deck and sac mountains to get mono blue or mono white cardd
I kinda like the at random bit
Right. It’s within Red’s wheelhouse and feels pretty red.
The random tempers the power. Naturally you can still abuse it in eternal formats.
Yeah. You *could* sac 7 lands, but you might just whiff 7 times and be down your hand and 7 lands
Also it becomes a dead card if it’s the only card in hand, just like SP and EV are dead if your gy is empty.
I like that. It's better than Hazoret's Undying Fury
Maybe
Ish
It has the potential to be better anyway
You can use deck manipulation to improve it; you can't with HUF.
Well...I mean, unless you want to go all Doomsday on it.
I like the 'burn the future to win today' attitude in red. It's a go for broke kind of card.
I'm actually happy with a lot of the design space WotC seems to be exploring in red.
Impulse draw has been a huge boon in edh
Outpost Siege is just great

Now we need to get some kind of card draw or selection in White. That space seems to be occupied by 'when you draw one I draw one'-style effects, for balance. That's a little strong if you go too far.
The land tax of draw
Perhaps more effects like "whenever an opponent draws a card, Scry 1'
I think card selection is the route in white, to keep some balance. Partial cards vs. straight out draw.
Well, they gave white focused draw
But I agree, I don't really like that for white.
I'm thinking effects that can balance for limited, etc.
Scry 1 is nice, but not OP.
What about effects that bump your opponents? Like path to exile for card draw?
It seems to fall into White's wheelhouse of keeping balance - you draw your threats and I can find, but not draw, some answers.
Or your opponent ramps, you draw 1

I think they'll only give white straight card draw when the player does something vs the opponent; I think the goal is to limit the other player(s) to maintain balance, so either limit their ability to draw, or force them to pay a tax to do so.
Perhaps effects like "whenever an opponent draws a card, if it's not the first card drawn this turn, they must pay 1 or exile a card from their hand" or the like.
I also like the wording they used on Alms collector "whenever an opponent draws 2 or more cards..."
Yeah, Alms Collector is great
I still think it's underrated
"oh, you're casting Brainstorm? That's cute."

Indeed, but I mean more about keeping balance. Effects that trigger when an opponent draws several cards. It still allows opponents to draw an extra card, but not a crazy number without consequence. That seems pretty White.
I love the joke in the name, that he's collecting alms for the poor White players who can't draw cards like you fancy players.
Lol. Like literally every other color
White is good for catch up. Most of its ramp effects are based on your opponents having more lands than you.
Even if it had cards like "each player with the fewest cards in hand draws a card" I think that could work.
Reverse [[Balance]] effects

attachments.fallback: Balance {1}{W} // Sorcery // Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.
attachments.title: Balance {1}{W}

text: Something I'm going to explore a bit if I advance in GDS3 is giving your opponents resources as a cost.
Good luck!

1U Wizard Dood

T, each opponent may loot: draw a card

1/1
Stuff like that.
Technically that's resource parity, but filtering cards is a pseudo resource.
We should probably move this to <#C8B5L7SLW|gds3>
True
Wow...that's some impressive Red ramp
Also, is that an emblem?
It's a red version of Boundless Realms
Kind of odd for red to care about the number of lands.
bit of a bend there
It's temporary. And also red is the color of fire and earth. I wish they did more with the earth aspect.
I'm not saying it's out of bounds, just traditionally red doesn't care about the number of lands you have.
Boundless Realms thins your deck. This just wins the game with Hellkite Tyrant or Revel in Riches
Henry, you're right. I hope it's less of a bend and more of a new direction for red.
Could be. I'm not against it at all.
As I said, red is the elemental color of earth, it would be nice to see that aspect used more liberally.
Red has had rituals before, this is kinda that
7 mana ramp, yay!
still probably going in my breya deck
It's a 7-mana make x artifacts that happen to ramp. It does much more than that in red.
yeah, I like it better than what I wrote, but that is a pricey mana cost
If you have 7 lands when you cast it, you basically cast it for free.
7 mana storm enabler
Unlike Boundless Realms
Is that city’s blessing a monarch type marker/effect?
it just isn’t the most busted card ever
Nope - not at all busted.
that’s a good question Dana
Lovely if you have token doublers in Gruul
its a very edh deck
er, card
We don't know what it is. It may be a new card type
It's on curve with Sunbird's Invocation... :wink:
jesus, hahaha
Potentially <@U4V5EHQ2G> since Monarch was originally planned for this block.
Interesting that there's no reminder text that describes what it does. Monarch token has it.
might have cards that say “If you have the city’s blessing, do X”
so it does different things if you have it
I wonder if this is a modified monarch mechanic?!!

Based on the flavor text, I wonder if, at end of turn (if like Monarch) you gain control of the Immortal Sun artifact. Perhaps you get to gain control and search graveyards, hands and libraries for that card.
Something - (not necessarily that)
I'd be down
If it's difficult to gain or easy to lose the emblem, I'd be down.
<https://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/news/unstable-variants-2017-12-06>

attachments.title: Unstable Variants
attachments.text: As many players have noticed by now, the "216-ish" cards listed for Unstable were heavy on the "ish."

text: I think it was dumb to have variants other than cryptic command
it waters down the joke a little
I do like the art variants though
Other than art variants. I loved that about fallen empires
or the urza lands
I think it would be cool to have more rare art variants
I always liked the art variants, it's a pain to find out about them now
Like 1/100 rampant growths is some crazy art
I do like the novelmental getting differnt flavor text
MaRo needs slightly smaller shirts
Sounds like an Un-card.
<@U286Q175Y> You think the whole set is stupid so that really isn’t saying much. :smiling_imp:
<@U3RJ9VDRT> if he wears shirts that aren't the right size how will people know he's the mad scientist of card games?
I agree that he does look like he owns the same wardrobe as he had when he saw Mudhoney and Garbage on tour in '92. Such grunge.
I mean, i know I have shirts that the arms of are way too short, but I'm also not able to afford to tailor my shirts right now
and I'm not on camera ever
that you know of.
taht I care about
*wink*
We all care.
Free show at Patrick's place,
Oh you wind up paying for it...don't worry.
D:
I...what...dammit...
i love that movie

Re: augment/combined creatures interacting with Persist discussion from a few days ago: in today's Game Knights MaRo flickers an augmented creature and says it counts as one creature. So for persist I'd imagine it works the same way
Probably...it depends on whether it remains one creature in the graveyard.
Monster Masher, when the combined creature hits the graveyard, wouldn't they go back to their respective gys?
you'd think it would be the same as when it goes to exile
Mashed up creatures might behave differently with the gy, though, since wouldn't it technically go back to their owner's gys?
I'm agreeing with you, BTW, but just walking through the complete thought.

text: I don't know if you guys talked about this already, but I'm exhausted just trying to figure out how many variations of whatever there are out there
The different art for the same card I get, especially when it comes to different sects in the set, but functionally unique cards by the same name make it sound awful
Stop trying. Just go with the flow.
Ok fine
You just hate fun. Go play some Stax decks in traffic.
just let it happen

attachments.title: Unstable Variants
attachments.text: As many players have noticed by now, the "216-ish" cards listed for Unstable were heavy on the "ish."

text: I love fun, this type of fun just feels like more effort than it's worth
As <@U32LRG9NU> has been known to say, not everything is for everyone.
And I agree with that sentiment
I said from day 1 unsets aren't for me
Except LabMan...that’s for no one.
I mean, am i going to have fun while drafting it? probably
am i happy that they made this and not something I could use outside of un-formats, not at all
I'm looking forward to this Game Knights
its ok
It looks pretty fun, though MaRo’s face at times looks like he’s not having fun.
He could just be tired and really trying to be ‘on’ when the camera’s on him.
I think that’s just how normal face. We’re so used to seeing him be an exploding ball of excitement that when he goes to neutral it looks bizarre to us
MaRo also hates commander.
Sure, but they weren’t playing EDH.
He hates commander players then
Oh, I haven't watched it yet

A buddy of mine said something I thought was interesting about the unset and MaRo: how many uncards do you think Maro "pocketed" and intentionally kept as an uncard instead of tweaking it to be a black bordered card? This was originally when we were talking about ineffable blessing, which almost could have been real, like an enchantment version of Soul of the harvest.
So now instead of something cool and/or powerful we either have to wait or will never seen the black bordered version of it

Not to sound too much like Jason, but that’s a stupid thing to worry about. It’s significantly likely that the designs he pocketed, if any, weren’t going to be made anyway. Hundreds of cards we’ll never see get designed for any new set. He had energy in his back pocket ever since Mirrodin. Unstable isn’t a collection of stolen designs, it’s a bunch of shit that already didn’t make the cut
Not sure he has the power to do that even if he was so petty anyway
Though I'm sure a lot of Kangee pilots are pissed about Crow Storm
Not for the next five weeks they’re not :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes:
What's wrong with sounding too much like me? Honestly
doesn't want to encroach on the Alt Brand
That’s how it starts. First you sound like jason. Then you call people poors. Before you know it you look like guy fieri
I think a Gay Fieri would be fabulous, though
Imagine if he knew how to dress himself
The flames wouldn't just be on his shirts?
Or Crocs
I still wear those Crocs
With socks.
It turns out Crocs are comfortable and I have  no shame when my hair looks like Joey Fatone's
Did you get the little bedazzler things you can put in the holes to decorate them?

If it weren't for comedy, I would wear pajamas pants all day. I really applaud stay at home Moms for not turning into total pieces of garbage for thousands of years. I have had a taste of the good life and it's made me a total slob
I live like a bachelor and it's going to be tough to teach a little girl how to act like a lady when I act like an art school student
Become a beatnik art student. At least they dress up.
I don't got all kinds of money for berets. What do I look like, Scrooge McDuck with beret money?
Make your own out of bulk. You ARE dressed like an art student.
I’m curious, <@U32LRG9NU>. Did your comedy change after becoming a father?
Yeah, it got way better
I can't tell if my focus changing helped or of I was always going to improve
But now it is way less abstract and more relatable, although my best stuff before was about my wife anyway
I was going to ask if it became more relatable.
You try not to do the same old dad jokes as everyone else, but older crowds like it better than every other 20-something on the lineup being all "hue hue Tinder sux amirite"
